column5: I'd like to extend our best wishes to all this Christmas...and for a happy and healthy new year.  My 4 year old daughter iced some cookies for Santa...then wrote him a letter...then spread reindeer food all over the front walk.  Here are some pictures....the smiles and concentration on her face says it all.  She actually wanted to go to bed early so that Santa would come sooner.  Oh to be a kid again...the excitement....the anticipation.....
Priceless - simply priceless   Merry Christmas to you and your family    Don

thats very amazing cliff,our little one was all excited to,she left santa 1 cold beer and some cookies,hhmmmmmtheres an idea,well we will talk to you tommorow take care and merry christmas from our family to yours
Nice! My boy is three and a half and lemmee tell ya, he's pumped! Most fun I've had on X-Mas Eve in a long time!  Merry Christmas all!
....Heart warming Cliff, thank you. Merry Christmas

I agree ccmt. I was telling the wife the other day there better be something for me from Santa under the tree or all my Christmas dreams will be shattered. I haven't had him miss me once yet.  Enjoy your Christmas with the wee one.  Mike

Thank you all...they grow up so fast...she's at the BEST age as far as Christmas is concerned.  I'm most excited to see her reaction tomorrow.  She was literally squealing as we left her room for the night.  I think I'm almost as excited as she is.....

Great pics ccmt.  If their is one thing i miss most about christmas....Its my kids being that age again at this time of year.  Make the most of it because they grow up real fast and i mean real fast.  Merry xmas
Great post CCMT.  I spent the night with the Grand Daughters (6&8) and it was a GREAT night.  Lots of magic in the air!!
Priceless Cliff! Thanks for sharing that with us!
I have similar pictures of Sleded this evening.  Cute pics. Those were the days. Merry Christmas!
Yup i got one too...How cute is that?.....LOL....
I gave Eric his present early. He was so excited to have a brand new bag of onions.

I remember when I was so excited for Christmas morning.  Then, once I had kids of my own, I had more fun with the kids.  Now, as time rolls on, it is the grandkids.   We had four of them here this past Friday and got three others coming in later today.  Ahhhhh - the majic of Christmas day.
Great pics Cliff, hope your little one had a wonderful Christmas morning too.
Great stuff there!!  My boys left cookies and carrotts out last night....great time of year!  dk
